title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3 HEALTH SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Output 1.3 Health systems in Yemen are better able to provide and promote improved utilization of quality and efficient health services, including both preventive and curative care at facility and community levels, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more vulnerable neonates, infants and children survive and thrive and fewer women die during pregnancy and childbirth

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3 Health systems in Yemen are better able to provide and promote improved utilization of quality and efficient healthservices, including both preventive and curative care at facility and community levels

description.narrative: ;Support to MoPHP to develop the community-based health strategy and update the training curriculum for the CHWs.Maintained and scaled up community health and nutrition services in rural areas. Through 2076 CHWs alone reached more than 1.7 million population out of which 510,346 were women of reproductive age, 509,872 were under 5 children. ;Additional 720 CHWs trained in 2021.Supported through COVID-19 community shielding initiative 47,000 households in Aden and Taiz.Built capacity of 4 governorate health offices on DHIS-2 implementation and reporting (1,130 information officers for PHC programs including CHWs, EPI, IMCI, RH and Nutrition). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
